body:
Thanks for reporting this @Guoyoyo, we do expect migration from MLflow 0.9.1 to 1.0.0 to work when using file-backed storage (.eg. `/data` in your case).

Would you be able to share the JS stacktrace? You can find the stacktrace by opening the developer console (e.g. as described in https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/open, basically right-click -> click inspect -> open the "console" tab).

I'm using file-backend storage with MLflow 0.6.0 and want to upgrade to MLflow v1.2.0 (latest as of this writing).... if I should write up another issue, I can, but this seemed relevant.  Performing the following does not work as expected, and I didn't find any documentation on the process.

```
# mlflow db upgrade file:///data_1.2.0/
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/bin/mlflow", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/mlflow/db.py", line 22, in upgrade
    if mlflow.store.db.utils._is_initialized_before_mlflow_1(url):
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/mlflow/store/db/utils.py", line 69, in _is_initialized_before_mlflow_1
    engine = sqlalchemy.create_engine(url)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/__init__.py", line 450, in create_engine
    return strategy.create(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/strategies.py", line 61, in create
    entrypoint = u._get_entrypoint()
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/url.py", line 172, in _get_entrypoint
    cls = registry.load(name)
  File "/var/opt/mlflow/venv_1.2.0/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/langhelpers.py", line 240, in load
    "Can't load plugin: %s:%s" % (self.group, name)
sqlalchemy.exc.NoSuchModuleError: Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:file
```
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has not been interacted with for 60 days since it was marked as stale! As such, the issue is now closed. If you have this issue or more information, please re-open the issue!

Guys @Guoyoyo , @smurching, @cappaberra 
I wonder if someone successfully migrated from pre-1.0.0 to 1.x?

We have 0.8.1 and no DB. As I understand - we can migrate in such way:
1. MLFlow 0.8.1 -> 0.8.2 -> 0.9.0 -> 1.0.0
2. Then we should switch file-backend  -> db-backend
3. Re-import everything in DB (I found only this script https://gist.github.com/bnekolny/8ec96faa0d57913eea6bb7848c06b912)
Am I right?

Hi, sorry can not help you.
I finally remove all experiments and recreate a new service with nwer
version 1.7.2 now.

Best,
Guoyoyo

Valera <notifications@github.com> 於 2020年5月12日 週二 上午12:04寫道：

> Guys @Guoyoyo <https://github.com/Guoyoyo> , @smurching
> <https://github.com/smurching>, @cappaberra
> <https://github.com/cappaberra>
> I wonder if someone successfully migrated from pre-1.0.0 to 1.x?
>
> We have 0.8.1 and no DB. As I understand - we can migrate in such way:
>
>    1. MLFlow 0.8.1 -> 0.8.2 -> 0.9.0 -> 1.0.0
>    2. Then we should switch file-backend -> db-backend
>    3. Re-import everything in DB (I found only this script
>    https://gist.github.com/bnekolny/8ec96faa0d57913eea6bb7848c06b912)
